text: A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation d = v t, so for this question the answer will be 200 m.

A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation d = v t, so for this question the answer will be 200 m.

questions.question: A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover?

solution.description: The correct answer for the question is given by the equation $d = v t$.
For this question the answer is $d = 10\ \text{m/s} \times 20\ \text{s} = 200\ \text{m}$.
